title: "I dont wanna play with you, you're cursed"
body:
To preface: I have a really good friend who I've known for 2+ years now and we duo ranked all the time. 

Problem is, he's now certain I'm cursed and no longer wants to play with me.

"Everytime I queue with you it ends my winstreak. You must have terrible MMR."

I'm an adc main in gold, while he...I don't even know, he plays mainly Yi and Udyr jg and Yasuo and Garen mid.

He thinks that everytime I play with him, I "make our teammates feed" and then we lose, ending his winning streak. He says he doesnt wanna queue anymore to save his lp.

Look at my previous two games, both played with him (he was yasuo 1 game and garen the other), the team didn't do too badly, but we just couldn't pull out the win.

So is this bad mentality by him, or am I doing something to the matchmaking?

replies.body:
Sounds to me like you two have trouble closing out games together and your friend is looking for someone to blame for it, which in this case is you. MMR aside I think the problem is your friends mentality-if he's quick to blame you for losses then chances are he does that to other people as well. If it was just one time and he apologized for it then that'd be one thing, but if he's been doing this allot recently then there's a problem with him.

In other words this is a bad mentality by him and he needs to grow up and start looking at himself rather than being so quick to blame others for his losses.

Yep. His mentality is utterly horrific. Whenever there's a lee sin on the enemy team, he immediately goes "guess I'm not getting to play the game today". It's pretty much a meme between us by now that whenver there's a lee sin, he'll be mid the entire game.

He's also very keen to blame anyone at all. If he dies to a support roam, its always "why isn't this botlane pinging/following", not "maybe I should've warded/not played so aggressively." In fact, one game he survived a Fizz all-in with about 5% hp left, decided to stay in lane without recalling, and died to Morgana running mid with mobis from base and pressing w on him, then proceeded to blame me for "no ss".

If that's the case then maybe you should consider ending your friendship with him, or at the very least give him a warning before doing so.

I remember one time in the MMORPG Wizard101 a few years ago one of my long time friends managed to unlock Open Chat (18+, more freedom than standard Text Chat (13+)) and for a time let it go to his head that he could say things that I couldn't see due to having Text Chat at the time (Open Chat only phrases appear as "..." to those with Text Chat), and later on he started being pretty rude and disrespectful to others (I had to report him for it during one such time). Eventually it got to the point where I basically told him "Look, I've been keeping you on my friends list in light of our past friendship, but I warn you if you keep acting this then I will be forced to end our friendship." That along with him getting a temp ban from the game was a wake-up call for him as he later apologized to me for his behavior and even thanked me for reporting him when I confirmed I did after he asked me about it and I've had no issues with him since then.

Sometimes all it takes is a warning from a friend (and possibly a temp ban) to be the wake-up call one needs. If you warn him and he still refuses to change his attitude then perhaps it's best to sever ties with him altogether, as if you ask me it's not worth the hassle of playing with someone like that.

I'm afraid that won't help sadly. A good few months ago, he was getting very tilted in game, flaming his support and me (the jungler) in chat. I don't think he actually realised how toxic he was being. I warned him multiple times that he needed to calm down or I and others would report him, but it never did anything. 

Sure enough, soon after he decided to leave and play on his own (I assume he was tilted with me for having a poor game) and what do you know? Because he played consecutive games on tilt, he ended up tilting harder and flaming more in his next game and received a toxicity ban. Perma ban - he'd already been chat restricted twice, banned once, and this wasn't even his first account - his first account had received 7 or 8 temp bans  before it finally got perma'd. 

When he saw that one of the games he'd been banned for was the one in which I said I would report him, he fumed at me. Said it was my fault, yada yada, then stopped talking to me for two days. I think he blocked me on Instagram for the 2 days as well LOL, he was furious, even though he likely would've been banned anyway since our support that game was also fed up with being flamed and threatened reports as well.

Actually, he just recently got a 2 week ban for flaming again and I've had to lend him one of my accounts that he can use for the duration. He doesn't learn.

I used to be pretty damn toxic myself actually, but I came to the conclusion that it's entirely pointless to flame people. Nowadays I rarely use chat unless it's for shotcalls and things like "bot no flash" "kayn top care" etc. I mute flamers, something I never used to do (I used to argue back with them all the time lol)

Him on the other hand? He likes to blame other people when he dies. He plays yi jungle quite a bit, but I dont think he quite understands what priority is. Whenever I play jungle with him I always think out loud, giving him my thought process partly because it helps me decide what to do next and partly so he can tell what I'm doing and apply it to his own jungle gameplay. For instance, I'd say "I'm thinking about ganking bot, but Jax might be bot for a countergank, so it's too risky" or "I think Udyr might gank mid, he just finished his raptors and you're pushed. I'm going to hover mid for a countergank." "I'm going to contest this scuttle-crab. My bot and midlane both have priority so it should be free." "I just saw Kha topside, I'm gonna solo this dragon."

Despite that, he never really learned from listening to my thought process when playing jungle (I used to be a Warwick one-trick in jungle and he taught me a good thing or two about the role, I'd say I jungle at a high gold/low plat level) and every single time something goes wrong, teammates are to blame. He tries to 1v1 an enemy jungler like Jax that out-duels him and his midlane doesn't have priority, resulting in his death. "Wtf mid why don't you move."

Then when he ganks a losing lane and dies, he starts flaming the losing laner, who's likely tilted enough already from losing lane, saying stuff like "ok I wont  come again, didnt know you fed him 3 kills", "wtf did you do to him?" or even just "stop feeding"

i mean, as a laner I'd be damn tilted if I was already losing my lane (especially top), my jungler comes for a gank while being level 6 to level 9, feeds my laner yet another kill then says he's not gonna come back. 

I mean, he's a decent guy when not getting tilted at league and pretty funny to play with when he's chill and not tilted, but when he is it becomes a problem. I might try and work with him to reduce the toxicity because I'm fully certain it's costing him some games. If you're losing a game, typing to your team and tilting them just solidifies the loss.. and if they encounter you in the next lobby they might decide to int you or afk as revenge.

i get this XD evrytime i have to go jungle when im playing with my friend group i will get fed ….. BUT evry lane will loose 

now i know thats my bad and im just a bad jungler buts its my curse and its kind of a running joke kinda funny to know im not the only cursed one XD

btw im a adc /top main normaly

It may be a combination of three things:

1) Your friend has bad mentality.
2) Your MMR matches your teammates against counterparts they cannot handle.
3) You are cursed.
It's Senna, of course she's cursed.

My mmr is gold though. I lose about 15 lp and gain 24.

Competitive games, ruining friendships since prehistory.

Your difference in rating does affect matchmaking. Playing together, the system predicts you'll play better together than solo, and it averages your MMR. The other players in your team are more likely to be matched against stronger players and the better player in the duo will have to carry more often.

So your buddy isn't wrong.
Yup.  Whenever you duo queue, matchmaking will assume you have better communication than a bunch of rando and will pitch you against higher team average mmr to compensate.

There is only so much you can do to counter superstitious thinking and a magical world view.

You should ask him if he believes there's a way your curse/hex can be lifted...

maybe your mmr really differs too much so the game fills this up by putting bad players into your team.

cant blame your friend, ritos system sucks too much.

I actually have this as well with my friend. Every single time we duo queue we get some of the worst of the worst.

He plays top and I play mid/jg, and nearly every game our bot lane goes a combined score of like 1-11 in the first 10 minutes.
